guys i have something real weird going on.  if i do /etc/init.d/apache2 start, it just jumps back to the command prompt with no response but /usr/sbin/apache2 will start up apache2.  any ideas whats going on here?
dpkg -S /etc/init.d/apache2 will tell you what package owns that file
I would 'sudo apt-get remove --purge apache2' and then reinstall, that might fix it
that will blast my config files as well correct?
thanks very much, i got apache2 working now by doing that.  How would i got about making sure it runs at boottime?
I think that gets set automatically, basically just make sure it is symlinked in /etc/rc2.d
